title.rendered: 27 Simply Superb Things To Do This Weekend In Melbourne

content.rendered:
The weekend is here, and the city is waiting. We’ve picked out our top things to do in Melbourne this weekend, including everything you’ve got to see, eat, drink, and do to squeeze every last drop of fun out of Saturday and Sunday – and even Friday night, too! We update our weekend guide to Melbourne every week, so bookmark this page and check back for a never-ending supply of inspiration of the best things to do in Melbourne this weekend. Let’s dive in…

1. See the Yayoi Kusama exhibition at NGV

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Secret Melbourne (@secretmelbourne)

Nearly 200 works by Yayoi Kusama have taken over NGV, for Australia’s largest ever Kusama retrospective. See iconic pieces from the celebrated Japanese artist’s eight-decade career, as well as never-before-seen works. Find out more here.

2. Immerse yourself in a sensory experience at SENSAS

Round up some friends and tackle some fun challenges at SENSAS. Test all five of your senses in some wacky experiences. This playful space is now open. Get your tickets here.

3. Immerse yourself in a thrilling Darkfield experience

Step into a shipping container, lose yourself in the darkness and challenge your grip on reality in the immersive Darkfield experiences. Try their most popular experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, at the Forecourt of Arts Centre Melbourne. Find out more here.

4. See Shakespeare Under the Stars

Shakespeare Under The Stars is coming back to Royal Botanic Gardens with a production of The Merry Wives of Windsor. Sprawl out on Southern Cross Lawn and enjoy the show from December 21 to January 25.

5. See the whimsical Accidentally Wes Anderson exhibition

An exhibition inspired by the colour and symmetry of Wes Anderson films is now open in Melbourne. See over 200 curated photos from around the world, explored themed areas and have fun with interactive sets. Accidentally Wes Anderson: The Exhibition is open from Wednesdays to Sundays. Get your tickets here.

6. Feel like you’re on holiday at Moon Dog Beach Club

Moon Dog Beach Club opened in Frankston just before Christmas, and swinging by for tropical cocktails, seafood platters, DJs and more sounds mighty like one of the best things to do in Melbourne this weekend.

7. Feel the sparks at the Museum of Desire

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Secret Melbourne (@secretmelbourne)

At the Museum of Desire, you’ll find over 20 sensory-rich experiences that explore desire and pleasure. Feeling curious? Get your tickets here.

8. Keep it kawaii at the Hello Kitty Cafe

Head to Chadstone and have fun at the Hello Kitty Cafe, which is celebrating the 50th anniversary of the beloved Sanrio character. On top of the delightful food and drink, there’s also a selection of limited-edition merchandise and an installation. It’s around until December 31, so this is your last weekend to check it out – find out more here.

9. Check out the Myer Christmas Windows

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Secret Melbourne (@secretmelbourne)

One of Melbourne’s most beloved holiday traditions has returned for another edition. This year’s Myer Christmas Windows — the 69th year in which they’ve been displayed — take viewers on an adventure through Australia Zoo with the Irwin family, making for a delightful journey that blends the magic of the holidays with the wonders of wildlife. The windows are open every day until January 5, 2025, from 7:30am to 10pm, so this is one of the final weekends to see them. Find out more here.

10. See a free street art exhibition with over 100 works

Head to the corner of Hosier Lane and marvel at incredible works of art in The Outsiders Melbourne exhibition. Taken from the Sandrew Collection, the impressive exhibition includes a room dedicated to Banksy, as well as pieces from Rone and more. It’s on until May 25.

SEE ALSO: For even more things to do in Melbourne this weekend, check out our late-night guide to the city

11. Watch movies under the stars at Moonlight Cinema

Enjoy the summer nights by watching festive favourites and new releases at Moonlight Cinema. Find it on the lush Central Lawn at Royal Botanic Gardens — find out more here.

12. Lock in plans to check out Alcotraz

In this interactive experience, you’ll smuggle liquor into prison and receive up to four personalised cocktails. Alcotraz is open in Melbourne, and it’s ideal for parties, team buildings, or just a grand night out with friends. Get your tickets here.

13. Explore the Antopia exhibition at Melbourne Museum

Shrink down to the size of an ant and experience a day in the colony at Antopia. This interactive exhibition will feature projections, immersive spaces and more to help you learn about the secrets of ants. Find it at Melbourne Museum until March 10.

14. See the Notre-Dame cathedral without flying to Paris

Embark on a journey through the cathedral at Notre-Dame de Paris, the Augmented Exhibition. With the help of an augmented reality tablet, you’ll journey through the cathedral’s 850-year-history. Catch it now at the Immigration Museum.

15. Feel the Force at The Fans Strike Back exhibition

If you love Star Wars, then this exhibition is for you. Fly to a galaxy far, far away, and see over 600 items collected by fans, for fans. See sculptures, life-size figures, costumes and more! The Fan Strikes Back exhibition is now open at The District Docklands. Get your tickets here.

16. Wander through this free installation at NGV

Explore a house within a house at the 2024 NGV Architecture Commission, Home Truth. Designed by architecture studio Breathe, this installation invites you to reflect on how small-scale architecture can encourage more sustainable living environments. It’s free to visit, and will stay in town until April 27.

17. Have a pawsome time at this huge Cats & Dogs exhibition

Explore our love for Cats & Dogs at a wholesome new exhibition, which features over 250 works of art and design from both contemporary and historical artists. It’s on now at Fed Square’s Ian Potter Centre – head here for more details.

18. Walk among the dinosaurs at Jurassic World: The Exhibition

Journey through the iconic Jurassic World gates and come face-to-face with roaring dinosaurs from the legendary movie franchise. Encounter a brachiosaurus, velociraptors, a Tyrannosaurus Rex and more at the Fever Exhibition and Experience Centre in Brunswick. Get your tickets here.

19-22. Sing along at a magical Melbourne musical

Get ready to sing praises to the smash-hit musical scene that Melbourne offers. There are plenty of ongoing shows to enjoy; here are some of the ones we’re loving right now!

🙏 Sister Act, at the Regent Theatre until January 26, 2025
🩵 Dear Evan Hansen, at the Playhouse at Arts Centre Melbourne until February 16, 2025
🎤 TINA: The Tina Turner Musical, at the Princess Theatre until March 2, 2025
🌹 Beauty and the Beast, at Her Majesty’s Theatre until April, 2025

SEE ALSO: The Most Refreshing Things To Do In Melbourne On A Hot Day

23. Feel the magic at this sultry stage show

Fire up the group chat and book your spot for an unforgettable night out with Australia’s top-rated male revue, Magic Men. This electrifying two-hour show features some of Melbourne’s hottest hunks, known for their incredible moves and equally impressive physiques. If you’re in the mood for a heart-pounding night out that promises pure entertainment, this is the weekend event for you. Find out more — and book your tickets — here.

24. See what’s happening at MPavilion

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by MPavilion (@mpavilion)

MPavilion is back in Melbourne, along with some viral grey gelato that’s been making waves on social media. Enjoy cultural events, talks, music and more until March 22, 2025. See the full program here.

25. Check out all the happenings at ACMI

Explore how futures are imagined across film, videogames and screen-based art in The Future & Other Fictions at ACMI. Then, have a gander at the development behind the beloved Untitled Goose Game at the free exhibition, Honk! Untitled Goose Exhibition. Whatever delights are on offer here, ACMI remains one of our very favourite things to do in Melbourne on a weekend.

26. Have fun at this Cherry Picking Festival

CherryHill Orchards are in the final weeks of their delightful Cherry Picking Festival, and you can still wander through rows of trees in Wandin East, eat as many cherries as you like straight from the tree, and pack some cherries to take home. During the festival, there will also be food trucks, cherry ice cream, cherry drinks and special experiences. The festival in Wandin East will end in early January, so don’t miss your chance!

27. Dazzle your senses with the stunning Christmas Festival of Lights at Adventure Park

Christmas might be over, but you can keep the festive fun going by heading to Geelong and basking in the glow of 3.3 million lights at this gorgeous festival. Wander down enchanting trails and glittering bridges in this 50-acre wonderland, which remains one of our favourite things to do in Melbourne on a summer weekend. On top of the glistening lights, there’s plenty of Christmas activities and entertainment for the family. See more here.

Meanwhile, here are the best things to do in Melbourne in January 2025.

<script type="application/ld+json" class="yoast-schema-graph">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@graph":[{"@type":"NewsArticle","@id":"https://secretmelbourne.com/things-to-do-melbourne-weekend/#article","isPartOf":{"@id":"https://secretmelbourne.com/things-to-do-melbourne-weekend/"},"author":{"name":"Nicole de Souza","@id":"https://secretmelbourne.com/#/schema/person/f426e65fc6a2259aa61fdbf0cedacef0"},"headline":"27 Simply Superb Things To Do This Weekend In Melbourne","datePublished":"2022-02-25T04:15:51+00:00","dateModified":"2024-12-23T18:00:12+00:00","mainEntityOfPage":{"@id":"https://secretmelbourne.com/things-to-do-melbourne-weekend/"},"wordCount":2055,"commentCount":0,"publisher":{"@id":"https://secretmelbourne.com/#organization"},"image":{"@id":"https://secretmelbourne.com/things-to-do-melbourne-weekend/#primaryimage"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://offloadmedia.feverup.com/secretmelbourne.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/02/24044638/Things-to-do-in-Melbourne-this-weekend.jpg","keywords":["local trip"],"articleSection":["Things To Do"],"inLanguage":"en-AU","potentialAction":[{"@type":"CommentAction","name":"Comment","target":["https://secretmelbourne.com/things-to-do-melbourne-weekend/#respond"]}],"articleBody":"The weekend is here, and the city is waiting. We've picked out our top things to do in Melbourne this weekend, including everything you've got to see, eat, drink, and do to squeeze every last drop of fun out of Saturday and Sunday - and even Friday night, too! We update our weekend guide to Melbourne every week, so bookmark this page and check back for a never-ending supply of inspiration of the best things to do in Melbourne this weekend. Let's dive in...1. See the  at NGVNearly 200 works by Yayoi Kusama have taken over NGV, for Australia's largest ever Kusama retrospective. See iconic pieces from the celebrated Japanese artist's eight-decade career, as well as never-before-seen works. Find out more .2. Immerse yourself in a sensory experience at Round up some friends and tackle some fun challenges at SENSAS. Test all five of your senses in some wacky experiences. This playful space is now open. 3. Immerse yourself in a thrilling  experienceSupplied/Credit: Axis ProductionsStep into a shipping container, lose yourself in the darkness and challenge your grip on reality in the immersive Darkfield experiences. Try their most popular experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, at the Forecourt of Arts Centre Melbourne. Find out more .4. See Source: SuppliedShakespeare Under The Stars is coming back to Royal Botanic Gardens with a production of The Merry Wives of Windsor. Sprawl out on Southern Cross Lawn and enjoy the show from December 21 to January 25.5. See the whimsical  exhibitionAn exhibition inspired by the colour and symmetry of Wes Anderson films is now open in Melbourne. See over 200 curated photos from around the world, explored themed areas and have fun with interactive sets. Accidentally Wes Anderson: The Exhibition is open from Wednesdays to Sundays. .6. Feel like you're on holiday at Moon Dog Beach Club opened in Frankston just before Christmas, and swinging by for tropical cocktails, seafood platters, DJs and more sounds mighty like one of the best things to do in Melbourne this weekend.7. Feel the sparks at the At the Museum of Desire, you’ll find over 20 sensory-rich experiences that explore desire and pleasure. Feeling curious? .8. Keep it kawaii at the Head to Chadstone and have fun at the Hello Kitty Cafe, which is celebrating the 50th anniversary of the beloved Sanrio character. On top of the delightful food and drink, there's also a selection of limited-edition merchandise and an installation. It's around until December 31, so this is your last weekend to check it out - .9. Check out the One of Melbourne's most beloved holiday traditions has returned for another edition. This year's Myer Christmas Windows — the 69th year in which they've been displayed — take viewers on an adventure through Australia Zoo with the Irwin family, making for a delightful journey that blends the magic of the holidays with the wonders of wildlife. The windows are open every day until January 5, 2025, from 7:30am to 10pm, so this is one of the final weekends to see them. .10. See a  with over 100 worksHead to the corner of Hosier Lane and marvel at incredible works of art in The Outsiders Melbourne exhibition. Taken from the Sandrew Collection, the impressive exhibition includes a room dedicated to Banksy, as well as pieces from Rone and more. It's on until May 25.SEE ALSO: 11. Watch movies under the stars at Source: SuppliedEnjoy the summer nights by watching festive favourites and new releases at Moonlight Cinema. Find it on the lush Central Lawn at Royal Botanic Gardens — find out more .12. Lock in plans to check out In this interactive experience, you’ll smuggle liquor into prison and receive up to four personalised cocktails. Alcotraz is open in Melbourne, and it's ideal for parties, team buildings, or just a grand night out with friends. .13. Explore the  at Melbourne MuseumShrink down to the size of an ant and experience a day in the colony at Antopia. This interactive exhibition will feature projections, immersive spaces and more to help you learn about the secrets of ants. Find it at Melbourne Museum until March 10.14. See the  without flying to ParisEmbark on a journey through the cathedral at Notre-Dame de Paris, the Augmented Exhibition. With the help of an augmented reality tablet, you’ll journey through the cathedral’s 850-year-history. Catch it now at the Immigration Museum.15. Feel the Force at  exhibitionIf you love Star Wars, then this exhibition is for you. Fly to a galaxy far, far away, and see over 600 items collected by fans, for fans. See sculptures, life-size figures, costumes and more! The Fan Strikes Back exhibition is now open at The District Docklands. 16. Wander through  at NGVExplore a house within a house at the 2024 NGV Architecture Commission, Home Truth. Designed by architecture studio Breathe, this installation invites you to reflect on how small-scale architecture can encourage more sustainable living environments. It's free to visit, and will stay in town until April 27.17. Have a pawsome time at this huge Explore our love for Cats & Dogs at a wholesome new exhibition, which features over 250 works of art and design from both contemporary and historical artists. It's on now at Fed Square's Ian Potter Centre – 18. Walk among the dinosaurs at Journey through the iconic Jurassic World gates and come face-to-face with roaring dinosaurs from the legendary movie franchise. Encounter a brachiosaurus, velociraptors, a Tyrannosaurus Rex and more at the Fever Exhibition and Experience Centre in Brunswick. 19-22. Sing along at a magical Melbourne musicalGet ready to sing praises to the smash-hit musical scene that Melbourne offers. @graph.headline: 27 Simply Superb Things To Do This Weekend In Melbourne
@graph.articleBody: The weekend is here, and the city is waiting. We've picked out our top things to do in Melbourne this weekend, including everything you've got to see, eat, drink, and do to squeeze every last drop of fun out of Saturday and Sunday - and even Friday night, too! We update our weekend guide to Melbourne every week, so bookmark this page and check back for a never-ending supply of inspiration of the best things to do in Melbourne this weekend. Let's dive in...1. See the  at NGVNearly 200 works by Yayoi Kusama have taken over NGV, for Australia's largest ever Kusama retrospective. See iconic pieces from the celebrated Japanese artist's eight-decade career, as well as never-before-seen works. Find out more .2. Immerse yourself in a sensory experience at Round up some friends and tackle some fun challenges at SENSAS. Test all five of your senses in some wacky experiences. This playful space is now open. 3. Immerse yourself in a thrilling  experienceSupplied/Credit: Axis ProductionsStep into a shipping container, lose yourself in the darkness and challenge your grip on reality in the immersive Darkfield experiences. Try their most popular experiences, SÉANCE and FLIGHT, at the Forecourt of Arts Centre Melbourne. Find out more .4. See Source: SuppliedShakespeare Under The Stars is coming back to Royal Botanic Gardens with a production of The Merry Wives of Windsor. Sprawl out on Southern Cross Lawn and enjoy the show from December 21 to January 25.5. See the whimsical  exhibitionAn exhibition inspired by the colour and symmetry of Wes Anderson films is now open in Melbourne. See over 200 curated photos from around the world, explored themed areas and have fun with interactive sets. Accidentally Wes Anderson: The Exhibition is open from Wednesdays to Sundays. .6. Feel like you're on holiday at Moon Dog Beach Club opened in Frankston just before Christmas, and swinging by for tropical cocktails, seafood platters, DJs and more sounds mighty like one of the best things to do in Melbourne this weekend.7. Feel the sparks at the At the Museum of Desire, you’ll find over 20 sensory-rich experiences that explore desire and pleasure. Feeling curious? .8. Keep it kawaii at the Head to Chadstone and have fun at the Hello Kitty Cafe, which is celebrating the 50th anniversary of the beloved Sanrio character. On top of the delightful food and drink, there's also a selection of limited-edition merchandise and an installation. It's around until December 31, so this is your last weekend to check it out - .9. Check out the One of Melbourne's most beloved holiday traditions has returned for another edition. This year's Myer Christmas Windows — the 69th year in which they've been displayed — take viewers on an adventure through Australia Zoo with the Irwin family, making for a delightful journey that blends the magic of the holidays with the wonders of wildlife. The windows are open every day until January 5, 2025, from 7:30am to 10pm, so this is one of the final weekends to see them. .10. See a  with over 100 worksHead to the corner of Hosier Lane and marvel at incredible works of art in The Outsiders Melbourne exhibition. Taken from the Sandrew Collection, the impressive exhibition includes a room dedicated to Banksy, as well as pieces from Rone and more. It's on until May 25.SEE ALSO: 11. Watch movies under the stars at Source: SuppliedEnjoy the summer nights by watching festive favourites and new releases at Moonlight Cinema. Find it on the lush Central Lawn at Royal Botanic Gardens — find out more .12. Lock in plans to check out In this interactive experience, you’ll smuggle liquor into prison and receive up to four personalised cocktails. Alcotraz is open in Melbourne, and it's ideal for parties, team buildings, or just a grand night out with friends. .13. Explore the  at Melbourne MuseumShrink down to the size of an ant and experience a day in the colony at Antopia. This interactive exhibition will feature projections, immersive spaces and more to help you learn about the secrets of ants. Find it at Melbourne Museum until March 10.14. See the  without flying to ParisEmbark on a journey through the cathedral at Notre-Dame de Paris, the Augmented Exhibition. With the help of an augmented reality tablet, you’ll journey through the cathedral’s 850-year-history. Catch it now at the Immigration Museum.15. Feel the Force at  exhibitionIf you love Star Wars, then this exhibition is for you. Fly to a galaxy far, far away, and see over 600 items collected by fans, for fans. See sculptures, life-size figures, costumes and more! The Fan Strikes Back exhibition is now open at The District Docklands. 16. Wander through  at NGVExplore a house within a house at the 2024 NGV Architecture Commission, Home Truth. Designed by architecture studio Breathe, this installation invites you to reflect on how small-scale architecture can encourage more sustainable living environments. It's free to visit, and will stay in town until April 27.17. Have a pawsome time at this huge Explore our love for Cats & Dogs at a wholesome new exhibition, which features over 250 works of art and design from both contemporary and historical artists. It's on now at Fed Square's Ian Potter Centre – 18. Walk among the dinosaurs at Journey through the iconic Jurassic World gates and come face-to-face with roaring dinosaurs from the legendary movie franchise. Encounter a brachiosaurus, velociraptors, a Tyrannosaurus Rex and more at the Fever Exhibition and Experience Centre in Brunswick. 19-22. If you’re in the mood for a heart-pounding night out that promises pure entertainment, this is the weekend event for you. Find out more — and book your tickets — .24. Enjoy cultural events, talks, music and more until March 22, 2025. See the full program .25. Whatever delights are on offer here, ACMI remains one of our very favourite things to do in Melbourne on a weekend.26.
